Sentencas: Nitrous oxide (N2O) is an environmentally damaging gas and alternative methods for its abatement are needed.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, we developed an electrochemical route using the mixed ionic electronic conductor Sr2Fe15Mo05O6-delta (SFMO) as electrocatalyst for N2O reduction in the temperature range of 600-800 degrees C, at ambient pressure, for application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrode mechanism, studied by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS), is discussed to involve a competition between both O-2 and N2O species, particularly at lower temperatures, where N2O thermal decomposition is lower.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In terms of electrocatalytic properties, galvanostatic transients were used to assess N2O electroreduction on the SFMO electrode.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results showed that, after cathodic polarization, the N2O conversion increases.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In particular, a highest Faradaic efficiency (|Lambda|) of 3.94 was obtained at 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The reversibility of the mechanism was also assessed, and the results showed that the reaction rate returns to its open circuit value upon current interruption.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This work indicates, therefore, that the electrochemical promotion of N2O reduction can be an attractive tool to be implemented for the reduction of this environmentally damaging gas in SOFC systems.
Titulo: Strontium iron molybdenum oxide as electrocatalyst for nitrous oxide reduction in solid oxide fuel cells
